sense.name: physical injury or damage
sense.examples: The victim shows trauma to the jaw and neck. The blast trauma from the bomb was extensive. The blunt trauma to the body indicates it was hit by a car.

sense.name: state of psychological shock
sense.examples: These war orphans have experienced deep psychological trauma. The patient discussed her childhood traumas with the therapist. He never overcame the trauma of witnessing that execution.

sense.name: agent or cause of extreme upset
sense.examples: The trauma of an all-out nuclear war is difficult to even comprehend. The product delay has been a major trauma for Sally's department. A minor trauma occurred at the party when Mary accidentally poured tea down her boss's shirt.
